page.title: 09The Coach & Horses
page.content: One of the two pubs in{Faldingworth is called{The Coach & Horses.}It is a free house but it mainly relies on Bateman's. Its owners are Mr.and Mrs. Prescott and its owners before the Second World War were Mr.and Mrs. Croft. It was built in the 1800's. It has a pool table, space invaders, darts and toilets inside. It has swings, a caravan park and a car park outside. It brewed it's own ale in the 1830's. It was open 12 hours a day and 6 days a week. Now it is open 8 hours a day and 7 days a week in the summer. In the winter it is closed on Mondays. It has a restaurant with a varied menu which is open whenever the pub is open. There's a special every day which costs Â£2.50. It has seating for 30. It has bar snacks, starters, main meal, desserts and a cheese selection.
